brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the study is to implement and measure the efficiency of a standardized
      acute and brief non-pharmacological intervention (Cognitive interventions on Sleep - Anxiety
      - Attention - Memory) following mild TBI and observe their impact pre- and post-treatments.
      The ultimate goal is to have patients be re-integrated to their activities faster with
      lesser symptoms and have patients present lesser post-concussive symptoms. Specific
      objectives: 1) Measure the effect of an acute and brief non-pharmacological intervention on
      PCS symptoms, sleep, headaches, affect, cognition and functional outcome following mild TBI;
      2)To redefine a model of outcome prediction following mild TBI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of Mild TBI

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Psychiatric diagnosis

clinical_study.official_title: Acute and Brief Intervention Following Mild Traumatic Brain Injury: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

authority: Canada: Ministère santé et services sociaux du Québec
Canada: Public Health Agency of Canada

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
